New fiction for January 2015

The missing and the dead by Stuart MacBride

Instead of an exciting murder case, Detective Inspector Logan McRae gets a ‘development opportunity’ in the depths of rural Aberdeenshire. However, a little girl’s body washes up outside the sleepy town of Banff, kicking off a manhunt. McRae’s old colleagues stomp around the countryside, burning bridges, and he gets dragged into the investigation.

 

Runaway by Peter May

In 1965, five teenage friends fled Glasgow for London to pursue their dream of musical stardom – but only three returned. In 2015, a murder forces those men, to journey back to London and confront the dark truth.

 

Die again by Tess Gerritsen

Detective Jane Rizzoli and forensic pathologist Maura Isles investigate a gruesome murder, unravelling the case of linked murders outside the city of Boston.

 

Three amazing things about you by Jill Mansell

Hallie is terminally ill and secretly in love, much to the dismay of her friends.

 

The cake shop in the garden by Carole Matthews

Fay Merryweather’s busy life is distracted by Danny Wilde. He makes Fay feel things she’s never felt before and she is inexplicably drawn to Danny. However, a sudden tragedy changes the turn of events.

 

The Cheapside corpse by Susanna Gregory

London, 1665: Thomas Chaloner investigates the murder of Dick Wheler, one of the few goldsmith-bankers to have survived the losses that have driven others to bankruptcy. Chaloner’s foray into the world of the financiers who live in and around Cheapside convinces him that they are just as great a threat as the Dutch, but their power and greed thwart him at every turn.

 

Stella Mia by Rosanna Chiofalo (eBook)

Poignant novel about families that evokes the stunning scenery of Sicily and the Aeolian Islands.

 

Crunch Time: Henry Christie Series, Book 12 by Nick Oldham (eBook)

Leaping at the chance to work undercover again, DCI Henry Christie must ingratiate himself with Ryan Ingram, one of London’s top criminals, who has relocated to the north of England.

 

The Firebird’s Feather by Majorie Eccles (eBook)

Set in 1911, 18 year old Kitty Challoner investigates the murder of her mother in the midst of social turmoil.
